skill.name: security-audit
skill.description: Security auditing and vulnerability assessment specialist. Use when conducting security reviews, analyzing code for vulnerabilities, performing OWASP assessments, or creating security audit reports.
skill.summary: Security auditing and vulnerability assessment specialist. Use when conducting security reviews, ana...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing no executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution. All 39 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting markdown syntax (code fences as backticks, CWE references as cryptographic algorithms, and template placeholders as template injection). The skill contains only documentation, templates, and guidelines for security auditing methodology.

content.value_statement: Security audits require systematic methodology and comprehensive checklists. This skill provides OWASP Top 10 guidance, vulnerability assessment frameworks, and audit report templates for thorough security reviews.
actual_capabilities: Identify and classify vulnerabilities with CVSS scoring
Create remediation roadmaps with prioritized fixes
limitations: Does not perform live testing or execute penetration tests
Does not access or analyze private code repositories directly
Does not replace manual security expert review
Provides guidance based on publicly available security knowledge

use_cases.title: Prepare Security Audits
use_cases.description: Use OWASP checklists and audit templates to plan and document comprehensive security assessments.

use_cases.title: Review Code Before Release
use_cases.description: Identify vulnerabilities in code before deployment using systematic review methodologies.

use_cases.title: Document Security Compliance
use_cases.description: Generate professional security audit reports that meet regulatory compliance requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Vulnerability Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security review of this code and identify the most critical vulnerabilities. List findings with CVSS scores and CWE references.

prompt_templates.title: OWASP Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct an OWASP Top 10 assessment for this application. For each category, indicate whether vulnerabilities were found and describe the findings.

prompt_templates.title: Dependency Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these dependencies for known vulnerabilities. List any CVEs, their severity scores, and recommended remediation steps.

prompt_templates.title: Full Audit Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete security audit report using the security-audit template. Include executive summary, findings by severity, OWASP mapping, and remediation roadmap.

output_examples.input: Review this authentication module for security issues: [code snippet with login function using plaintext password comparison]
output: Finding: The authentication function compares user input directly against a plaintext password stored in the code.
Impact: Anyone with access to the codebase can obtain credentials and authenticate as any user.
Remediation: Remove hardcoded credentials. Implement secure password hashing with bcrypt or Argon2. Use environment variables or a secrets manager for sensitive values.

output_examples.input: Perform OWASP Top 10 assessment on this REST API code
output: A01: Broken Access Control - MEDIUM - Missing authorization checks on user endpoints
A02: Cryptographic Failures - LOW - Sensitive data logged in plain text
A03: Injection - HIGH - SQL injection risk in user search function
A05: Security Misconfiguration - Informational - Verbose error messages enabled
A07: Authentication Failures - MEDIUM - No rate limiting on login endpoint

best_practices: Start with critical severity findings and work through to lower-risk issues
Always provide proof-of-concept examples when demonstrating vulnerabilities
Document evidence and references for each finding to support remediation efforts
anti_patterns: Relying solely on automated scanning tools without manual code review
Skipping lower-severity issues that may indicate deeper design flaws
Treating security review as a one-time event instead of ongoing process

faq.question: Which programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill works with any programming language. Security concepts and templates are language-agnostic.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with security scanning tools?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance for interpreting tool outputs but does not directly execute or integrate with external scanners.

faq.question: What compliance frameworks are covered?
faq.answer: OWASP Top 10 2021 is the primary framework. Guidance can be adapted for PCI-DSS, HIPAA, and SOC 2 requirements.

faq.question: Is my code and data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill. Your code is processed only within your AI session and is never transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why are my audit reports not generating?
faq.answer: Ensure you provide the actual code or vulnerability details for analysis. The skill needs specific content to reference in templates.

faq.question: How does this compare to commercial security tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides methodology and documentation guidance. It supplements but does not replace automated scanners or expert penetration testers.
